intro: Hosackia endlichii, commonly known as the Endlicher's false indigo, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features slender, upright stems and trifoliate leaves with a distinctive blue-green color. It produces small, yellow flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Hosackia endlichii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
